result.value:
The ECO-CollecTF annotations are licensed under the Creative Commons BY NC 4.0 license. 

For details, please see: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/

This corpus is based on 84 articles from the PubMed Central Open Access subset and contains derivative works of them.

The derivatives consist of the ASCII text of the Results section or Results and Discussion section, depending on the contents of the article. The ASCII text of each article is saved in an individual file, with each sentence on a separate line.
 
The license of the original work applies to the extracted section. To see the license, consult the original article in the articles subdirectories. Attributions may also be found in the articles subdirectories in the .copyright files.

These changes do not suggest the licensor endorses this usage.

The ECO-CollecTF code is licensed under GPL 3.0. The code is supplied under the code directory in the following subdirectories: 
* PrepFiles: code that was run to download the XMLs of the open access documents and create the ASCII text to use for brat annotation.
* IAA: calculate the Cohen's K and the KwIC IAA scores.
* ECOUsage: generates the CSV file that was used by the team to select ECO examples of use.

The ECO-CollecTF annotations and code are licensed under the Creative Commons BY NC 4.0 license. 
For details, please see: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/. 

This corpus is based on 54 articles from the PubMed Central Open Access subset and contains derivative works of them. 
For more information, please see acknowledgments.txt in the corpus subdirectory.

result.description: Release for Frontiers Research Topic "Semantic Resources and Text Mining"
result.name: ECO-CollecTF v1.2

result.description: Version 1.1 of ECO-CollecTF contains a corpus of 54 annotated, open access documents (derived from open access articles). Annotations were made with the Evidence and Conclusion Ontology (ECO). The code used to obtain and create the documents, generate the IAA scores, and two example uses is also in this version. This release was generated for depositing in Zenodo.
result.name: Initial Zenodo Release

result.description: Version 1.0 of ECO-CollecTF contains a corpus of 54 annotated, open access documents (derived from open access articles). Annotations were made with the Evidence and Conclusion Ontology (ECO). The code used to obtain and create the documents, generate the IAA scores, and two example uses is also in this version.
result.name: Version 1.0
